title: CBLCM - Chesapeake Bay Land Change Model
summary: "The CBLCM is an open-source pseudo-cellular automata land change model tailored for loose coupling with watershed models. The CBLCM simulates infill and redevelopment, residential and commercial development, forest and farmland conversion to development, and growth served by sewer or septic wastewater treatment. These data are produced at a 30m-resolution, a scale appropriate for input into both spatially distributed and lumped parameter watershed models. The CBLCM is unique among land change models by simulating multiple types of development and explicitly accounting for infill, redevelopment, and development densities. The CBLCM was used to simulate four future land use scenarios for the Chesapeake Bay watershed from 2013 to 2055 [...]
body:
"The CBLCM is an open-source pseudo-cellular automata land change model tailored for loose coupling with watershed models. The CBLCM simulates infill and redevelopment, residential and commercial development, forest and farmland conversion to development, and growth served by sewer or septic wastewater treatment. These data are produced at a 30m-resolution, a scale appropriate for input into both spatially distributed and lumped parameter watershed models. The CBLCM is unique among land change models by simulating multiple types of development and explicitly accounting for infill, redevelopment, and development densities. The CBLCM was used to simulate four future land use scenarios for the Chesapeake Bay watershed from 2013 to 2055 and validated against county-scale estimates of land consumption in the state of Maryland."
 

Model Name (Name of the model, including acronyms):

CBLCM - Chesapeake Bay Land Change Model

Model Version (Version of the model, (i.e., 2.0)):

5.0

Abstract (Description or summary of the model, including its purpose or goals and the type or formalism of the model (e.g., system dynamic, agent based model, machine learning), preferably accompanied by relevant keywords):

"The CBLCM is an open-source pseudo-cellular automata land change model tailored for loose coupling with watershed models. The CBLCM simulates infill and redevelopment, residential and commercial development, forest and farmland conversion to development, and growth served by sewer or septic wastewater treatment. These data are produced at a 30m-resolution, a scale appropriate for input into both spatially distributed and lumped parameter watershed models. The CBLCM is unique among land change models by simulating multiple types of development and explicitly accounting for infill, redevelopment, and development densities. The CBLCM was used to simulate four future land use scenarios for the Chesapeake Bay watershed from 2013 to 2055 and validated against county-scale estimates of land consumption in the state of Maryland."

Originator(s) (Name(s) of the model developer(s)/author(s)):

Peter Claggett

Contact Name(s) and Email Address(es) (Names of person(s) responsible for maintenance of the model along with their email):

Peter Claggett (pclaggett@usgs.gov)

Model Type (theoretical model, empirical model, or list both):

stochastic model

Tags (Keywords or tags that describe the model (i.e., "groundwater, aquifer, Southwest")):
